text: hey everyone I'm Andrew Knowlton the
restaurant and drinks editor Bon Appetit
and today I'm here to show you how to
shuck an oyster so to shuck an oyster at
home you're only gonna need two tools
the first is an oyster knife don't use a
regular knife at home because you'll
hurt yourself and then you can use one
of two things to protect your hand you
can use a side towel which you'll see
some of the pros doing this is what
you're gonna want to buy it's a crazy
medieval stainless steel mesh gloves so
what we're gonna do is just grip the
oyster and basically what you want to do
is just wedge the wedge the knife right
down in and you're not pushing in you're
just kind of wiggling it in and
sometimes you'll get what what happened
here sometimes the oyster will shed a
little bit of its shell but just keep
going down applying light pressure there
we go
so then it kind of just pops up but then
you've got a little muscle that's gonna
be attached to the top so what you want
to do is clean your knife off and then
you just kind of want to you can even
take your glove off if you want at this
point if you want to basically clean
your knife and then you're just gonna
run this to the top of the shell the
main thing is just to get in there and
you can feel that little muscle that
other muscle attached there so there's
one down and I like to just serve it you
should always serve oysters on ice that
is - nobody wants the lukewarm oyster so
this holiday get a bag of oysters get
them online invite a few people over and
bring the oyster bar to your home
